My Best was I was doing well in a game on Mundo and we got the nexus open but we started losing after that. I sold three of my non-essential tank items for attack speed and ad items and TP'd next the the nexus on the ward I had put next to it. But Immediately the enemy fed Tristana was there and ulted me away from it and started chewing through my remaining 3 tank items. But I finished off the nexus with 150 hp left.

Sadly I don't have a video, but I've won a game where we had a full 5v5 team fight in the enemy base and I was the only one alive .... on Soraka, so I was able to destoy the nexus solo (with the help of some minions).
Never underestimate the power of the banana.
Only need 50g to win the game :3
{{sticker:zombie-nunu-bummed}} Is this a nunu pepe
better nerf irelia

I have to say the craziest win I ever had was a ranked game as Tristana. We had lost the team fight at baron, 4 kills to their 5. The only remaining member of their team was a Nasus with about 1K stacks. he starts pushing into our base easily shredding our inhibitor tower and inhibitor. He proceeds to demolishing our Nexus turrets. With about 15 seconds left before I come back and about 25 before any of my teammates can join me I know I have to act fast trading my boots enchantment to homeguard, I'm poised and ready to strike both turrets down and with an army of minions Nasus begins to make short work of our nexus, with each blow another nail in our coffin. He begins to circle around to the back of our nexus. Far from the ruins of our fallen tower, far from his minions and closer to our fountain. I spawn, and in an instant I'm out and jumping over his head, another q lands the nexus only has about 150 health left and with super minions now rolling in I know there is no chance for us... unless, ulting Nasus, he flies into the fountain where he is quickly dispatched by my now spawning allies and the fountain. now to turn my attention towards the growing wave of minions on our doorstep. The nexus health ticks away slowly... 112... 87... 53... there is only one  minion left now... 21... I deal the final blow but not before his last ditch auto attack is loosed 21..... 1HP.... Quickly I seize the opportunity with Nasus dead for another 50 seconds, I react in an instant, charging down the lane I have my eyes set on their exposed Nexus. Miss Fortune blocks my path, but none will stand in the way of my victory. I blow her and her petty Sona to pieces and push onward towards their Nexus. something isn't right however where is Master Yi, The enemies jungler? Signaling for my allies to make a hasty retreat I press forward. Placing my faith into my team I trust that they will end Yi before he can end the game. I surge down the lane, My body kicks into overdrive as adrenaline pulses in and out of my fingertips. I can see the enemies inhibitor, its within my grasp. I'm standing at the threshold of victory and my cannon is pumping round after round into the tower. Morgana comes flying out of the fountain with me in her sights. Her dark binding shoots forth from her tormented hands. Without the slightest hesitation I flash around it and end her suffering. The now exposed inhibitor is now crumbling before me. With Master Yi failed attempt at backdooring, the only thing that stands before me and victory is 2 towers and Nasus whos spawn timer ticks away. I melt the first tower, my team is now midway down the map following my path of destruction. The second goes down. and Nasus comes at me with revenge on his mind and rage in his heart. I begin pumping rounds into the Nexus, I can't even see Nasus now, my eyes are trained on the Nexus. The wither goes up and Nasus is closing, I jump over the Nexus relentless in my assault, with each shot my heart skips a beat. The end is nigh and it couldn't be sweeter. All eyes, as if they weren't already, are drawn towards the enemies Nexus. With a mighty explosion victory is ours. The day is won.

The craziest way I won a game, happened like this.

-Score was 20-3 in a ranked game (my team losing)
-Enemy team knocked down every turrent, and inhib
- They are dropping the nexus health WHEN

"Enemy team agreed to surrender with 4 votes for and 1 against"

GG Bronze.

Setup:  So this one game, I was playing Kog'Maw and another guy on my team was Zed and we were about 20 kills behind and the enemy team was doing baron.  Zed and I were the only ones alive on our team and zed and I were running toward baron to see if we could do anything.  Enemy team had a fed Jax and Master Yi.  On Kog'Maw I have Runaan's because I was building for Teamfights mainly

So I get to baron first and manage to place a ward to get vision of baron.  Zed is on his way with homeguards from base when Baron is at about half health.  I noticed Yi smite baron at the start of them getting it, so I notice I have a chance to steal.  I activate my W and start chunking down the enemy team and baron with it.  I steal baron why killing Jax in the process and this is when Zed arrives.  We 2v5 them with the baron buff, I get a double and Zed gets a triple.  He and I proceed to push straight down mid lane to win the game.
Best win i can remember was when we were getting our asses kicked so we joking said in /all chat that we'd buy them skins if they surrendered. they did
The question is, did you end up actually buying them skins or did you just take the freelo?
best way to win a game... split pushing and getting 7 towers and two inhibs on your own, when your team is down 22 kills #gnarwallhopsop #bronzeliyfe

Not a win, but a loss. Had a Smurf from Plat 3 as a jungler Zac. He got fed, but refused to gank toplane cause it was trundle. I kept telling him to at least stop him from eating the turrets, he refused and got cocky and kept saying STFU, get carried noob. Well the score was 37v9, 37 my team, their Jinx gave up and joined Trundle pushing toplane. Which ended in Trundle and Jinx winning an impossible win game. 

I know he was a smurft later cause he added me to show off his plat 3 account and kept calling me a noob and having this huge ego. And I told him that having an ego was showing off something that ranks him higher than others just to make themselves feel good. He got pissed of and removed me. Well, their team didnt surrender for 40 minutes, instead they realized our fed Zac was ignoring toplane and won that way. 

In other words, don't get cocky and keep your ego in check.

The Irelia play was especially impressive to me, really smart use of Bladesurge and Equilibrium Strike to survive there for that crazy backdoor. I personally have won 3v5 when the other two members of my team who were at the same house lost internet around 25 minutes in, myself and my other two friends still in the game rallied back multiple times to win at the 50 minute mark with nexus turrets down. The power of Tryndamere cannot be understated! Super exhausting though.

Getting a penta on AP {{champion:81}} then using {{item:3100}} to destroy turrets & nexus.

And also http://matchhistory.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/#match-details/NA1/1999785392/37692327?tab=overview

Look at the beauty that is that game.
And no that is not the game where I got the penta.
{{champion:31}} Welp I'm a Fail Void Monster. UNINSTALL LEAGUE!

Craziest game i ever won was 65minutes in and the inhib respawns with our nexus at 11 health, even an extra caster minion hit would have finished it, we all spawn back up from the ace, homeguard over to the inhib and ace them before they could kill it, run down mid take inhib tower, inhib, both nexus towers and nexus for the game during the 80 second respawn timers.
TLDR: nexus at 11hp, ty based inhib

Last video: Why you don't go full tank Cho'gath :3

My craziest way? I was a fed Gangplank after crushing a Riven in lane (even sold my boots endgame), but the rest of the team was so behind that our only advantage was that we had an inhibitor turret but we were constantly defending because we kept losing all of ours. Came down to saving our Nexus with 300HP one time.
Later, the enemy took out almost my entire team when our ADC got caught, I only survived because of oranges to escape a charm and flash over the wall

Team thinks its GG because we have 3 open inhibs and no one to stop the baron...or so they think...

I suspect the enemy is low so I GP ult and actually snipe off the enemy Lee Sin with the center of the ult. Then the enemy's unsure whether to finish baron or kill me so I blow everyone up with barrels, steal baron while scoring a penta, then I ran all the way to the enemy base with the baron empowered minions and took down the nexus just as the respawns were coming in

I survived fighting the entire enemy team at Baron pit with 30HP to my name.

{{champion:41}} {{item:3031}} {{item:3078}} {{item:3142}} {{item:3035}} {{item:3071}} {{item:3087}} {{item:2140}}

Once I played a game (A REALLY long time ago, back in old SR. I don't even think there were trinkets) The total kill score was 32/6, the enemy team's favor. I was playing Sejuani, and we had a Xin Zhao and a Kayle.  (I don't remember the other two.) We only had out nexus left, and at this point they were just toying with us. The enemy team didn't use a pink ward for baron, so I charged in, stole baron and flashed out. Our Kayle proceeded to get a pentakill. So we shoved mid hard, and got the inhibitor. The enemy team showed up and killed Xin, myself, and the other two. Before Kayle got a pentakill again. After that she recalled and defended our nexus while we were respawning. She noticed they were going for baron (who was about to spawn again) and so she abandoned the nexus and charged in the baron pit. Using her ulting herself and then getting a quadra, before their Shaco managed to kill her. Then her Guardian Angel brought her back to life and she killed him. Getting ANOTHER pentakill. By now the inhibitor had respawned so all five of us pushed mid again, this time after the inhibitor pushing other lanes back and getting all inhibs. (For some reason they didn't try to backdoor.) They tried for one last time to stop us from pushing, but of course the 4 of us died and Kayle got yet ANOTHER pentakill, before pushing and winning us the game. 
  
   I did not make this story up. Our Kayle did get four pentakills in that game. It was incredible. (The enemy team was sitting their trashing talking us, swearing at us, and gloating since the ten minute mark of the game. It was hilarious to see their reactions when they lost.)

Craziest win I ever saw was soon after I started playing League.  I'm dating myself a bit, but that was a few months before Season 1 started.  I was in the computer lab watching five of my friends play.  They were slowly loosing with outer towers down, and the mid second tower gone.  Now I have to tell you that the computer lab we were in had a shutdown feature to restart all the computers at 1 am so they could do maintenance for 30 min.  You get a notification 5 min before the shutdown happens.  So suddenly the notification pops up on all the screens.  My friends start to panic, then one guy comes up with a fiendish plan.  He had everyone immediately recall, buy what they could, and charge mid.  The other team didn't realize what was going on; they were pushing both outer lanes with no opposition.  The poor guy in mid didn't know what happened.  Suddenly he was facing a 5v1 with no warning.  My friends cut through both  lane turrets, the inhibitor turret, and the inhibitor before the other team rallied.  They had been doing so well and suddenly, they could loose.  We finished one nexus turret, then there was a last ditch fight at the enemy nexus. Somehow my team came out on top with 2 champs left, who finished the turret and nexus to win.

After the game, we waited to see how much time we had left before the computers shut down.  It turned out the entire end of the game, from shutdown notification to win, had only taken 3 min out of the 5 we had.  My friends used this tactic several more times when they needed to finish a game quickly, and it worked every time.

Base race as a Yi vs 4 of the enemy team. Funny thing was, I won lol. The deficiencies of the old tank meta where everyone built tanky, bruisers were more tank than offensive, and glass cannon melees usually didn't work. Wasn't even fed, just a very very long game.
